instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.LCDBKLT_EN_L: What is LCDBKLT_EN_L? This signal enables the backlight when it is low.  _L means the signal asserts itself when the voltage is low. This signal needs to be low to enable backlight. .
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has CPU Vcore but doesn't chime or boot.
threads.message: Not sure where to go with this. USB mouse lights up. PRAM and SMC reset do nothing. No chime. No video/backlight. Vcore at 1.85V and 7Ω to ground. Any idea what might be happening? The board was very clean with only some minor corrosion around the SSD. I attached some pre-ultrasonic pics.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has CPU Vcore but doesn't chime or boot.
threads.message: PRAM reset done with external USB keyboard? Internal keyboard will not work when no trackpad or possible other issues.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has CPU Vcore but doesn't chime or boot.
threads.message: No change. I've had a trackpad hooked up and I could see that SMC reset was changing the magsafe light. I tried it again with an external keyboard and nothing happened.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has CPU Vcore but doesn't chime or boot.
threads.message:
Ok, just tried the PRAM reset with the internal trackpad and keyboard unplugged and it worked - board is booting. Those are my known-good test parts but it appears something about them being plugged in wouldn't let the board reset. No backlight still but other than that it seems good.
• I replaced the LCD connector. No change.
• The keyboard backlight is working.
• <SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL> is at 12.4V
• 0.3V on pin 1 of LCD connector.
• Voltage present on pins 28-30.
• F7700 is good. PPBUS voltage present.
• <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is at 3.4V.
• Data pins 3 and 4 have continuity to <RESISTOR>R7752</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7753</RESISTOR> and all the way through to pin 15 and 16 on <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>. Resistors are good.
• 3.3V on pin 8.
• Known-good 2015 screen. Image present.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has CPU Vcore but doesn't chime or boot.
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> high? You really sure you have a good 2015 LCD? Checked continuity to the end of a separate LCD cable to confirm connector is properly soldered?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has CPU Vcore but doesn't chime or boot.
threads.message:
Yeah, I just used that same screen a few minutes ago for another 2015 13" Retina with a backlight issue. That was just an LCD connector replacement. The screen worked normally with that board after the replacement. It's my test screen that I always use.

Yes, <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is high at 3.4V.

To be sure, I went through and tested all the pins through a cable. All good.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has CPU Vcore but doesn't chime or boot.
threads.message: Diode mode on pin 3 and 4? Not shorted together? Inspect <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> area.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has CPU Vcore but doesn't chime or boot.
threads.message:
Pin 3: .314
Pin 4: .313

Resistance between them is normal, around 3.1K

<CHIP>U7700</CHIP> was not hit by the spill and the whole area looks fine. I measured the pins in diode mode and they all match up with a good board. Resistors are all good. Continuity in the lines is good.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has CPU Vcore but doesn't chime or boot.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has CPU Vcore but doesn't chime or boot.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has CPU Vcore but doesn't chime or boot.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has CPU Vcore but doesn't chime or boot.
threads.message: You got me there, thanks. Blown trace near a pad at the top of the board in the <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PSR_EN</SIGNAL> line. Working.
